text: At Cooper, cardiologist Phillip Koren said he and colleagues have used the Lariat on the left atrial appendage of about 10 patients in the last six months. The closure was unsuccessful in a few of those cases, but in those, there have been no strokes, said Koren, deputy director of the Cooper Heart Institute. None of the 10 patients suffered adverse events from the device.
title: Penn study questions Lariat device to prevent stroke in heart patients

meta_data.description: In older patients with atrial fibrillation, cardiologists increasingly are using a snare-like device to close off a small sac in the heart thought to be the source of clots that can cause stroke in those with the abnormal heart rhythm.
